physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient had a history of recurrent respiratory papillomatosis (RRP) since age 5, with pulmonary involvement noted by age 10, requiring over 100 surgical interventions. At age 22, chest radiographs showed an enlarging right upper lobe mass, which was diagnosed as squamous cell carcinoma of the lung. He exhibited respiratory compromise.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient's condition progressed from RRP with multiple excisions to the development of invasive squamous cell carcinoma, indicated by weight loss and thoracic pain, ultimately leading to respiratory compromise and death approximately 1 year after carcinoma diagnosis.
